text.text_translated:
Scientists are asking more questions about special tiny parts in our body. These parts tell our body what to do. They want to know how these tiny parts help our brain and language grow.
Did some of these tiny parts change? Did this change give us language?
Scientists found a change in these tiny parts. This change happened 200,000 to 100,000 years ago. This change seems linked to speaking. It also helps our brain control our mouth and face.
Monkeys have similar tiny parts. But their tiny parts did not change.
We do not know how much these tiny parts affect language yet. But one day, we might find answers in our DNA. DNA is information in our body.

Scientists ask questions about genes. They want to know how genes affect our brain and language.
Did some genes change? Did this change give us language?
Scientists found a gene change. This change happened 200,000 to 100,000 years ago. This change seems linked to speaking. It also seems linked to our brain control. This is for our mouth and face.
Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not change.
We do not know how much genes affect language yet. But one day, we might find answers in our DNA.
